text: The Trumpet Blows is a 1934 American Pre-Code film directed by Stephen Roberts, featuring George Raft as a Mexican matador, Adolphe Menjou as a retired bandito clearly based on Pancho Villa, and Frances Drake as Chulita, the woman they both want to marry.Everett Aaker, The Films of George Raft, McFarland & Company, 2013, pp 49-50 The film was written by Bartlett Cormack and Wallace Smith, and directed by Stephen Roberts. The film was a box office disappointment. ==Cast== *George Raft as Manuel Montes *Adolphe Menjou as Pancho Montes *Frances Drake as Chulita *Sidney Toler as Pepi Sancho *Edward Ellis as Chato *Katherine DeMille as Lupe, the Maid ==Production== Helen Twelvetreees was originally announced as female lead. ==References== ==External links== * *Review of film at Variety Category:1934 films Category:American films Category:English-language films Category:Films directed by Stephen Roberts Category:1934 drama films Category:Films set in Mexico Category:American drama films Category:American black-and-white films
